column1: #Text=For the 17th-century queen of Imereti , see Darejan of Kakheti , Queen of Imereti .
#Text=Nestan-Darejan ( Georgian : ნესტან-დარეჯანი ; fl. 1556 – 1612 ) was queen consort of Kartli , a kingdom in eastern Georgia , as the wife of King Simon I , whom she married in 1559 .
#Text=Nestan-Darejan was a daughter of King Levan of Kakheti and a half-sister of Levan 's successor to the throne of Kingdom of Kakheti , Alexander II .
#Text=Her husband spent nearly five decades fighting the Safavid Iranian and Ottoman encroachments on his kingdom , twice losing his throne and personal freedom .
#Text=Nestan-Darejan suffered further , being humiliated by his half-brother , the king of Kakheti , who capitalized on Simon 's difficulties to attack and loot Kartli .

#Text=After Simon had been sent a prisoner to Iran in 1569 , Nestan-Darejan 's estates had been pillaged by Prince Bardzim Amilakhori , Alexander 's father-in-law ; and in 1580 , following Simon 's return to Kartli and his defeat by Alexander at Dighomi , the latter carried off after the battle his half-sister 's drawers on the point of a lance .
#Text=Nestan-Darejan outlived her husband and died sometime after 1612 , having mothered six children , including Simon 's successor to the throne of Kartli , George X .
#Text=Marriage
#Text=Nestan-Darejan was born of Levan of Kakheti 's second marriage to a daughter of the shamkhal of Tarki , whom the king married in 1529 after he divorced his first wife , Tinatin Gurieli .
#Text=Nestan-Darejan married Simon I of Kartli in 1559 .

#Text=This union was one of the first interdynastic marriages between the Kartlian and Kakhetian branches of the Bagrationi dynasty , holding sway over the two breakaway successors of the once united Kingdom of Georgia .
#Text=The union was followed by a pact between the two monarchies , one aim being to evict the Iranian garrison from Tbilisi , the capital of Kartli .
#Text=Levan of Kakheti eventually hung back , but allowed his son and heir , Prince Giorgi , to join Simon 's army .
#Text=The Georgians lost the ensuing confrontation and Giorgi was killed on the battlefield . [ 1 ]
#Text=Persecution
#Text=After the Iranian army captured Simon in battle and sent for imprisonment at Alamut in 1569 , Queen Nestan-Darejan found herself in a hostile environment in Kartli .

#Text=Main threats to her security came from her half-brother Alexander II , a disowned son of Levan , on whose death he succeeded as king of Kakheti , having defeated and massacred his half-brothers .

#Text=Out of favor with the Safavid protégé Daud-Khan — Simon 's Islamized brother and a rival ruler at Tbilisi , who was married to Alexander 's relative — the queen became a target of harassment by Prince Bardzim Amilakhori , Alexander II 's father-in-law , who , joined by the duke of Ksani , raided and completely looted her estate . [ 2 ]
#Text=Return to power

#Text=The invasion of the Ottoman army of the Georgian lands led by Lala Kara Mustafa Pasha and the quick collapse of Daud-Khan 's regime in 1578 compelled the Iranian government to release Simon as the only ruler capable to mount resistance to the Ottoman advance .
#Text=Back to his homeland , Simon had his domestic adversaries , including Prince Amilakhori , arrested .

#Text=Amilakhori and the duke of Ksani pleaded for mercy and approached Nestan-Darejan , who persuaded her husband to issue amnesty for them , having reclaimed , in return , what has been lost to these noblemen and , further , Akhalgori and Mejuda from the duke and Kaspi and Karbi from Amilakhori . [ 3 ]
#Text=Further misfortunes
#Text=Alexander of Kakheti 's enmity to Simon remained undiminished owing to his hatred of his half-sister .
#Text=In 1580 the Kakhetian army surprised Simon , staying without troops at Dighomi , and put him to flight .
#Text=Alexander could not get at Simon , but he , the Georgian chronicle says , dishonored Nestan-Darejan and , " like a brigand " , rode off bearing his half-sister 's drawers high upon a lance .
#Text=Simon vowed revenge and assaulted Alexander 's army at Chotori , putting the Kakhetians to rout and Alexander to flight . [ 2 ] [ 4 ] [ 5 ]
#Text=After years of heavy fighting , Simon 's turbulent reign ended in 1600 , when he was captured by the Ottoman army and sent in prison to Constantinople .
#Text=His son , George X , succeeded him .
#Text=Nestan-Darejan outlived both her son , who died in 1606 , and her husband , who died in captivity in 1611 .
#Text=His remains were brought by the Georgian merchant Diakvnishvili from Constantinople to Nestan-Darejan and interred at the cathedral of Mtskheta .
#Text=Nestan-Darejan 's subsequent life is obscure .

#Text=She lived on to see the accession to the throne of her young grandson , Luarsab II , subsequently a Christian martyr and saint of the Georgian Orthodox Church , and died sometime after 1612 . [ 6 ]
#Text=Children
#Text=Simon and Nestan-Darejan had six children , four sons and two daughters :
#Text=Prince Giorgi ( c. 1560 – 1606 ) , King of Kartli as George X ;
#Text=Prince Luarsab ( fl. 1561 – 1589 ) , taken as a hostage to Iran in 1582 ;
#Text=Prince Aleksandre ( fl. 1561 – 1589 ) ;
#Text=Prince Vakhtang ( fl. 1600 ) , sometime governor of Akhaldaba and Dirbi .
#Text=He had a son , Luarsab ( died in 1650 ) , adopted by King Rostom of Kartli in 1639 ;
#Text=Princess Elene ( fl. 1583 – 1609 ) , wife of Manuchar II Jaqeli , Atabag of Samtskhe ;
#Text=Princess Fahrijan-Begum ( fl. 1582 ) , who married Shahzada Sultan Hamza Mirza ( died in 1578 or 1586 ) , son of Shah Tahmasp I or Mohammed Khodabanda .
#Text=Ancestry
